basics.name: Jameson Nyeholt
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am Software Engineer living and working in beautiful Portland, Oregon with my wife Rachel & our dog Sophie, where we live out the dream of the 90's.  I currently work at Jama Software, where along with an amazing team of cross-functional engineers, I develop software tools for managing product development.  In my free time, I geek out on functional programming, IoT, transit mapping services, and mobile/wearable devices.  When I manage to escape the warm glow of a computer terminal, I enjoy camping, hiking, cooking, making cocktails, and a long list of stereotypically nerdy activities.

work.summary: At Jama I work with a cross-functional team of software engineers, where I work in both the front-end and backend, programming in Javascript & Java.
highlights: Worked alongside a team to develop features that improved ease of use in managing data, managing test steps, viewing system health, and navigating rule-based item relationships.

work.summary: At Snapflow I worked on the development of a single-page web application using the Angular.js framework, utilizing RESTFUL API's to build out complex user interfaces for Snapflow's SaaS application building service.  During my tenure, I helped transition projects & new hires between tulmutuous periods of growth & contraction.  The company is now defunct.
highlights: Kept progress of front-end development steady during a hire-up period after the departure of senior engineers.
Assisted in technical screening & interviews of software engineering candidates for both the Portland-based team, and a near-shore team in Mexico.

work.summary: 10TH DEGREE is an online advertising agency with an integrated team of creative technologists offering a full-range of digital capabilities & automotive marketing. Advertising agencies move people to take action and our job as your agency is to create ad campaigns that deliver exceptional results, then, make them better.

work.position: CMS Integration Project Manager & Applications Support
work.summary: Served as a liaison between OrgSync, Inc., Associated Students, Inc., and the Office of Student Life & Development as the primary project manager for the implementation of OrgSync's community management software at the California State University, Long Beach.  In my capacity as project manager, I was charged with providing technical support and aiding in the integration of the software into the workflow of several departments.

volunteer.summary: Helped mentor & assist former students of the Portland Code School complete their final projects after the school was abruptly closed without notice.
highlights: Helped the Project Pencil group move thir application forward, by providing code reviews and design feedback. https://github.com/Karandashnik/Project-Pencil
